data.title: Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park
data.text: Champaner Pavagadh Archaeological Park a UNESCO World Heritage Site is located in Panchmahal district in Gujarat India It is located around the historical city of Champaner a city which was founded by Vanraj Chavda the most prominent king of the Chavda Dynasty in the eighth century He named it after the name of his friend and general Champa also known later as Champaraj The heritage site is studded with forts with bastions starting from the hills of Pavagadh and extending into the city of Champaner The park s landscape includes archaeological historic and living cultural heritage monuments such as chalcolithic sites a hill fortress of an early Hindu capital and remains of the 16th century capital of the state of Gujarat There are palaces entrance gates and arches mosques tombs and temples residential complexes agricultural structures and water installations such as stepwells and tanks dating from the eighth to the 14th centuries The Kalika Mata Temple located on top of the high Pavagadh Hill is an important Hindu shrine in the region attracting large numbers of pilgrims throughout the year
